pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [605150c31a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22200/commits/605150c31a73c52852a36baf500e2b9aa00ddbd7)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsZeroOrMarkovKernel.comp`
`+ IsZeroOrMarkovKernel.compProd`
`+ comap_prod`
`+ comp_map`
`+ deterministic_congr`
`+ deterministic_map`
`+ deterministic_prod_apply'`
`+ id_comap`
`+ id_map`
`+ id_prod_apply'`
`+ id_prod_eq`
`+ lintegral_deterministic_prod`
`+ lintegral_id`
`+ lintegral_id'`
`+ lintegral_id_prod`
`+ lintegral_prod_deterministic`
`+ lintegral_prod_id`
`+ lintegral_prod_symm`
`+ map_comp_right`
`+ map_prod_eq`
`+ map_prod_map`
`+ prodAssoc_prod`
`++- map_apply_eq_iff_map_symm_apply_eq`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.02)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|44|1|large files|

Current commit [605150c31a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/605150c31a73c52852a36baf500e2b9aa00ddbd7)
Reference commit [745dc1a50a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/745dc1a50a9a1a4d8a07ff604cf0ef6c107b78a4)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Do you need the @ ? `α` should be inferred from `a`? Same question for the lemma below.
It can infer `α` but it cannot infer `mα` which is implicit in the definition of `Kernel.id`.

Swap the two sides of the equality on the right, to match `MeasurableEquiv.map_apply_eq_iff_map_symm_apply_eq`?
```suggestion
    κ.map f = η ↔ η.map f.symm = κ := by
```

I would rather be in favor of swapping the equality in `MeasurableEquiv.map_apply_eq_iff_map_symm_apply_eq` (which does not seem to be used anywhere else in the library). The reason is that when doing computations it seems more natural to me to say that I just transfer the equivalence on the right, and I don't have any reason to swap the inequality (in fact in my use case I would need to stop my rewrite and use `symm` to cancel the swap).
What do you think?
Swapping the sides of `MeasurableEquiv.map_apply_eq_iff_map_symm_apply_eq` instead is fine by me. I just want both written in the same way.
That does not seem very useful, especially if the two lemmas above become simp lemmas.
Can you put this lemma next to `map_comp`, below in the same file?

Your are taking the comap of a product, so I would call it
```suggestion
lemma comap_prod (κ : Kernel β γ) [IsSFiniteKernel κ] (η : Kernel β δ) [IsSFiniteKernel η]
```

This looks like a complicated and very specific equality. I have a hard time parsing it and I doubt that it's useful more than once.
You could remove it from this PR, and we'll discuss it when you PR the application that needs it. Or you have a clear and convincing explanation and you should put it in a docstring for the lemma.
I agree this is quite specific, I use it only once in a technical lemma in #22218 (it's the only non-trivial step of a long sequence of rewrites), so we'll see when we get there.

pullRequest.title: feat: add lemmas about kernels
